Universal Rules

  1. All site rules apply. Specific ones to mention are play to your win condition, no complex codes, and do not heavily insult another person in this game (insulting a play style is one thing, but being very harsh to a person isn’t allowed).
  2. Do not quote your role pm. Paraphrasing is fine.
  3. Do not quote any other mod communications. Paraphrasing is again fine. If you have a qt then while you still can’t quote anything I say in it, any of your comments are allowed to be quoted.
  4. Day 1 lasts a maximum two weeks. All days after that last a maximum of 10 days.
  5. Night phases last 48 hours.
  6. You will be prodded after 48 hours of inactivity and replaced after an additional 24 hours of not replying to a prod. You will be immediately replaced if you get three prods. You may ask me to prod a player if they’ve already gone 36 hours without posting and I haven’t done it yet.
  7. If you go on V/LA pm me or announce it in thread. I’ll count it anyway if you just put the V/LA banner on, but it’s preferable to mention it to me.
  8. Put votes in bold or use vote tags with the format vote: user (or no lynch if desired). If it looks like a vote, but the format is off then I’ll still count it.
  9. A player will be lynched at majority. A no lynch requires half of the people alive to vote no lynch.. Everyone that is alive (including the lynchee if a lynch occurs) is allowed to keep on talking during twilight.
  10. A no lynch will occur at deadline if there is no majority by then.
  11. Blue is my color. Do not use it. Any other color is allowed to use if desired. Do not impersonate the mod in any way. The only person besides me who can mod this game is my back up mod, RichardGHP.
  12. I have permission to edit these rules or add anything else that I deem to be missing. Use common sense when playing and ask me if what you’re going to do feels a bit against the rules.
  13. Rules are fairly short and concise, but finally do remember to enjoy the game as well.

Lastly this is what the town vanilla role pm looks like:

Town - VanillaActive Powers
  • None
Passive Powers
  • None

Win Condition: You win when all players who have a win condition that interferes with your own are dead.

Think of it as a sliding scale. I would not hesitate to lynch confirmed scum even if it gave no information. I would not hesitate to lynch confirmed town if for some wild-ass reason it would provide the town with a ton of good information. Most lynches fall somewhere in between, and so my goal when determining who I want to wagon is to find a person whose behavior is scummy and whose flip would tell us the most about the rest of the game. If someone is a little scummy but there is a benefit to lynching them either way, I may support their lynch (Monkey). If someone is more scummy, but there are somewhat fewer benefits to lynching them, I still support their lynch more because we have a greater chance of catching scum (-L-). If two people seem roughly equally scummy to me, I would rather lynch the one that gives us more info (-L- as opposed to Fitz).

This is generally how I think about the game as town. Perhaps I should emphasize it less on Day 1, when we don't have that much to go on anyway, but that's roughly my thought process.

To save anyone the effort of looking it up,

Gunsmith
Alignment: any
Role type: Informative
Choice: Night
The Gunsmith is an information role that can target a player at Night to learn if they have a gun in flavor. Members of the Mafia (that are not Doctors), Cops, FBI Agents, Vigilantes, other Gunsmiths, Paranoid Gun Owners, etc. all have guns in traditional flavor. Notably, Serial Killers and Doctors do not have guns.
Using these guidelines, Gunsmiths are considered Normal on mafiascum.net.
Gunsmiths are usually, but not necessarily, pro-Town. They are considered somewhat weaker than standard Cops and are usually included in setups where they can get positive results on players who are not Mafia-aligned.


My assessment of this role: It's a useful sounding role that is less likely to clash with someone else's claim than 'Doc' or 'Cop'. This makes it a weak claim since it is very unlikely to be counter-claimed if false.

2 & 4. 100% town wagons are intrinsically more likely to occur on scum than town (relative to random) for several reasons.
First and simplest, a scum isn't going to be on his or her own wagon. This means the pool of townies available for wagon participation is larger relative to the pool of scum than normal, increasing the probability of a 100% town wagon.

Next, town are in general better than random at voting for scum. Were they not, scum would have dominant win percentages (most setups require town to lynch better than random to win, and the scum voting block / elimination of accurate players stack the deck further). Thus a player several townies want lynched is a good person to lynch. Especially when there is no evidence that scum also desire the lynch (100% town wagon).

Additionally, scum want to help townies be wrong. They tend to support wagons on town by town by joining them rather than doing their own thing.
(This is separately a reason HD's sheeping of wagons on people who have flipped town D1 is scummy)
Thus the absence of scum from a wagon is an indicator that it may be on scum.

"Townies can be wrong" is not a 'valid point in response' to the above line of reasoning. You are simply mentioning another explanation of what happened which I already took into account before making the statement "Your 100% town wagon yesterday and Qwints' vote make you more likely to be scum."

OK thanks I had to look it up.

(In case anyone else is interested:) http://wiki.mafiascum.net/index.php?title=Sheeping
Sheeping (or Barning) is the act of following a popular wagon or popular player with no independent intent. The term "sheeping" comes from the notion of a mindless sheep following a shepherd; the term "barning" is derived from "barnacle".
Players who are frequently sheeped tend to be known as good scum hunters or thought very likely to be Town.
Players who frequently sheep tend to be players who acknowledge that their play is weak or that they have no independent idea of what to do.
Sheeping tends to lead to bandwagons. Players who consistently sheep tend to be seen as nuisances, difficult to read, and bad players simultaneously.

So what you were saying isn't that the case against her was BS.
Instead you kept a vote on her because she had earlier joined Slandaar in voting against you, in what you considered to be a case without any real basis?
Exactly.

2 & 4. 100% town wagons are intrinsically more likely to occur on scum than town (relative to random) for several reasons.
First and simplest, a scum isn't going to be on his or her own wagon. This means the pool of townies available for wagon participation is larger relative to the pool of scum than normal, increasing the probability of a 100% town wagon.

Next, town are in general better than random at voting for scum. Were they not, scum would have dominant win percentages (most setups require town to lynch better than random to win, and the scum voting block / elimination of accurate players stack the deck further). Thus a player several townies want lynched is a good person to lynch. Especially when there is no evidence that scum also desire the lynch (100% town wagon).

Additionally, scum want to help townies be wrong. They tend to support wagons on town by town by joining them rather than doing their own thing.
(This is separately a reason HD's sheeping of wagons on people who have flipped town D1 is scummy)
Thus the absence of scum from a wagon is an indicator that it may be on scum.

First, here's the page about Encryptor. Key thing to note is that it's existence probably means that only 2 of the assumed 3 mafia players could day talk, so they didn't have full day chat and for what it's worth the remaining 2 probably won't be able to confer during the day.
http://wiki.mafiascum.net/index.php?title=Encryptor wrote:Encryptor
An Encryptor is a role that allows people who can converse with it to talk during the Day phase. Otherwise, they are restricted to speaking during the Night phase.
While theoretically this role can be used for Masons and the like, in practice this role is Mafia-aligned and allows the Mafia to daytalk.

Use and Power
Encryptor is a difficult role to quantify the power of. It effectively amplifies the existing coordination skill of the people talking - people who already had no synergy won't get anything out of daytalk; people who are skilled at manipulating the Day game will find it a massive power boost. With that in mind, Encryptor is a potentially large buff to a scumteam - contingent on the scumteam's skill.

Note that including an Encryptor in a Mafia faction that has two members is equivalent to simply giving the faction daytalk outright.


Second, a player like Yates not knowing what a role of a flipped mafia was and not looking it up is at least as big a red flag as the one that kicked off all that drama against MM way back at the start of the game.
